titlStmt.titl: Prophylactic Peritoneal Dialysis Decreases Time to Achieve a Negative Fluid Balance After the Norwood Procedure
Prophylactic Peritoneal Dialysis Decreases Time to Achieve a Negative Fluid Balance After the Norwood Procedure

grantNo.agency: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

useStmt.restrctn: Author determines access on a case-by-case basis
Data-sharing agreement, including undertaking of confidentiality
useStmt.conditions: Access is permitted for external researchers, with limitations

Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. Only researchers with REB-approved projects may be permitted access to the deidentified data. A basic data sharing agreement form is required (ie. Agree to not attempt to re-identify the records so as to relate the information on the file to a particular person). The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.

setAvail.accsPlac: Data is currently stored on Dr. Ryerson's hard-drive.

stdyInfo.abstract: The objective of this study was to determine whether peritoneal dialysis (PD) catheter insertion decreases the time to achieve a negative 24 hour post-operative fluid balance and improve morbidity in neonates with hypoplastic left heart syndrome (HLHS) or its variants who undergo a Norwood procedure.

sumDscr.universe: Newborn infants with hypoplastic left heart syndrome (HLHS) or its variants.

dataColl.sampProc: There were 22 study participants. We calculated that enrollment of 22 patients would provide statistical power of 80% to detect a 24-hour reduction in the time to negative fluid balance (the minimal clinically important difference) assuming a standard deviation of 20 hours or approximately 0.83 days (based on institutional published data for the mean first postoperative day of negative balance of 2.7 plus/minus 0.83 days), with an alpha (type 1 error rate) of 0.05.
dataColl.frequenc: Data was collected until patients were discharged.
dataColl.cleanOps: REDCap was used to flag inconsistencies and the principal investigator reviewed every record.

othrStdyMat.relPubl: Ryerson, L.M, Mackie, A.S, Atallah, J, Joffe, A.R, Rebeyka, I.M, Ross, D.B, Adatia, I. (2015) Prophylactic peritoneal dialysis catheter does not decrease time to achieve a negative fluid balance after the Norwood procedure: A randomized controlled trial. The Journal of Thoracic and Cardiovascular Surgery, 149.1: 222-228.
